author: potuz
content: Notice that for forkchoice aggregation is useless: anyway we disaggregate to send to forkchoice individual attestations. The main reason to keep the aggregate is if the beacon node is asked for an aggregate to sign at 8 seconds

author: terence0083
content: Sure. I'm just saying the methodology is different. Aggregate everything (including atts in block) at 6.5s is slightly different than aggregating the best attestations for the aggregator. But the end number may be the same

author: terence0083
content: Another thing to note is Prysm Aggregator does consider 1 bit attestation from 6.5s - 8s. Aggregator will aggregate them at 8s but not apply them to the existing aggregated bucket but rather have them on its own bucket (maybe bug) and then compare them against the other aggregated atts at 6.5s mark. So it's useless
